body_html: Keras adds some metadata to Layers, that why model.summary can see them. Calling for example klayers.MaxPool2D()(x) will only call tf.layers.max_pooling2d(x, 2, 2) and adds some metadata to it. To add the metadata yourself, you should look into the Lambda layer.
body_text: Keras adds some metadata to Layers, that why model.summary can see them. Calling for example klayers.MaxPool2D()(x) will only call tf.layers.max_pooling2d(x, 2, 2) and adds some metadata to it. To add the metadata yourself, you should look into the Lambda layer.
body: Keras adds some metadata to Layers, that why model.summary can see them. Calling for example `klayers.MaxPool2D()(x)` will only call `tf.layers.max_pooling2d(x, 2, 2)` and adds some metadata to it. To add the metadata yourself, you should look into the `Lambda` layer.
